snippet: New York Foundling, which was part of the Administration for Children’s Services Close to Home program, was being intensely monitored for months before the arrest.
abstract: New York Foundling, group home program run by Administration for Children's Services, voluntarily ends its contract with New York City to run group home on Staten Island; move comes after Andrew Benitez, who went AWOL from a Foundling facility on numerous occasions, was arrested in fatal stabbing of another teenage off premises; arrest capped months of intense monitoring of agency for its nonsecure residences.
lead_paragraph: New York Foundling, which was part of the Administration for Children’s Services Close to Home program, was being intensely monitored for months before the arrest.

headline.main: Group Home Agency Ends City Contract After Resident Is Accused in Killing
headline.print_headline: Group Home Agency Ends City Contract After Resident Is Accused in Killing
